# 1) Where to save PDFs in your repo
pdf_dir <- "asset/pdfs"
dir.create(pdf_dir, recursive = TRUE, showWarnings = FALSE)

# 2) Your Dropbox share links → destination filenames
#    You can paste the normal "Share → Copy link" URLs here.
resources <- c(
  "https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fi/r0ut5skclz76v61u5zeix/CV_Lynn-Huang.pdf?rlkey=tn93vmvsjdhh6t4w9ntjmq2xp&st=66xzxoxw&dl=0" = "CV.pdf"
)

# Helper: convert a Dropbox share URL to a direct-download URL
dropbox_raw <- function(u) {
  u <- sub("^https://www.dropbox.com", "https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com", u)
  u <- sub("[?&]dl=0$", "", u)
  u
}

# Download only if content changed (avoid unnecessary commits)
download_if_changed <- function(url, dest_name) {
  url       <- dropbox_raw(url)
  dest_path <- file.path(pdf_dir, dest_name)
  tmp       <- tempfile(fileext = ".pdf")
  utils::download.file(url, tmp, mode = "wb", quiet = TRUE)
  if (!file.exists(dest_path) || !identical(tools::md5sum(tmp), tools::md5sum(dest_path))) {
    file.copy(tmp, dest_path, overwrite = TRUE)
    message("Updated: ", dest_path)
  } else {
    message("No change: ", dest_path)
  }
}

invisible(mapply(download_if_changed, names(resources), resources))
